Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of bodies found in the freezers, stating that there were 19 white female bodies.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the existence of the 19 white female bodies.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bodies found in the freezers were victims of a black man and that the phrase "Black Lives Matter" was carved into their skin.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the claim, such as it being a fabricated story or a hoax.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that it is a fake news story and has been debunked by experts.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of credibility and reliability, as it has been spread around the internet for a year despite being false.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
